alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 11:31AM EST until February 16 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EST/230 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana and Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Indiana, Crawford, Dubois, Harrison, Orange and Perry. In Kentucky, Breckinridge, Hancock and Meade. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EST /230 PM CST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1131 AM EST /1031 AM CST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jasper, Tell City, Brandenburg, Hawesville, English, Carefree Town, Mount Pleasant, Webster, Huntingburg and Ferdinand. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
